items.title: NEC wil Ajax opnieuw dwarsbomen: 'Vorig duel nog op mijn netvlies'
items.summary: NEC hoopt Ajax komende zaterdag opnieuw pijn te doen. In de Eredivisie staat een ontmoeting tussen de huidige nummers drie en vier van de Eredivisie op het programma. NEC weet hoe het is om de Amsterdammers te dwarsbomen.

items.title: LOUDEST walk-on of the Worlds? O'Connor fires up Ally Pally crowd with 'Zombie'!
items.summary: William O'Connor came out to the song 'Zombie' ahead of his World Championship Darts opener against Krzysztof Kciuk.

items.title: Swansea City vs Wrexham on Sky LIVE!
Suriname strikt ook Bogarde op weg naar cruciaal WK-kwalificatieduel
items.summary: Suriname doet er alles aan om volgend jaar alsnog aanwezig te zijn op het WK in Canada, Mexico en de Verenigde Staten. De afgelopen week werd de technische staf al flink versterkt en vrijdag maakt de Surinaamse bond bekend dat ook Melayro Bogarde voortaan uit zal komen als international voor de Natio .

items.title: Penetra straalt bij contractverlenging AZ: 'Later kan ik haar alles vertellen'
items.summary: AZ heeft het contract van Alexandre Penetra opengebroken. De 24-jarige centrale verdediger had nog een verbintenis tot medio 2028, maar ligt nu nog een jaar langer vast.

items.title: Bronzen Schild extra voeding voor Eredivisie-dromen van Havekotte
items.summary: Het is een bijzondere dag voor Mike Havekotte. De dertigjarige doelman van TOP Oss kreeg het Bronzen Schild uitgereikt als beste doelman van de tweede periode. Een verdiende bekroning voor de routinier die zich tot stabiele kracht heeft ontwikkeld.

items.title: Mohamed Salah apologised to Liverpool squad for outburst, reveals Curtis Jones
items.summary: Liverpool teammate discusses fallout from interview ‚ÄòHe apologised to us ‚Ä¶ That‚Äôs the man that he is‚Äô Curtis Jones has revealed Mohamed Salah apologised to the Liverpool squad for the fallout from his interview criticising the club and Arne Slot. Salah was omitted from Liverpool‚Äôs Champions League win against Inter having accused the club of throwing him under a bus in response to a poor run of results. The striker also claimed his relationship with Slot had broken down and that he had earned his position in the team after eight phenomenal seasons. Continue reading...

items.title: Northern Ireland native Smyth signs three-year deal with New Orleans Saints
items.summary: Northern Ireland native Charlie Smyth has been signed to the New Orleans Saints' active roster on a three-year contract.

items.title: Transfers Ajax: zestienjarige verdediger ondertekent eerste profcontract
items.summary: Ook buiten de transferperiode om volgt VI het transfernieuws bij Ajax op de voet, ook omdat het sneller dan je denkt alweer januari is. De doelwitten van de Amsterdammers, duiding van de clubwatcher, of aandacht in buitenlandse media. We verzamelen alles hier.

items.title: USMNT's Adams (torn MCL) out up to 3 months
items.summary: United States international Tyler Adams will be out for up to three months after tearing a medial collateral ligament, Bournemouth coach Andoni Iraola said Friday.

items.title: Chelsea's Maresca knocks back Man City rumors
items.summary: Chelsea head coach Enzo Maresca dismissed as "100% speculation" reports that he could replace Pep Guardiola at Manchester City.

items.title: Amorim: United's next title won't take 10 years
items.summary: Ruben Amorim believes Manchester United will be fighting for the Premier League title far sooner than the 10 or 11 years that Sir Alex Ferguson fears it could take.

items.title: PSG GK fractured hand during shootout heroics
items.summary: Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeper Matvey Safonov has been left with a fractured hand following his penalty shootout heroics to win the Intercontinental Cup.

items.title: Laurens' weekend preview: Mbapp√©'s quest to overtake Ronaldo, Spurs-Liverpool search for form, more
items.summary: What is Julien Laurens watching this weekend? For starters, Kylian Mbapp√©'s quest to make Madrid history, plus the Africa Cup of Nations kicks off.

items.title: Swiss star Wawrinka announces 2026 will be his final year on tour
items.summary: Known for possessing one of the most elegant one-handed backhands in the game, Stan Wawrinka has announced that 2026 will be his last year on tour.

items.title: Merson: Arsenal will win the league... and Pep will quit when it happens
items.summary: Paul Merson says Arsenal will win the Premier League this season and believes that title success for Mikel Arteta's side could force Pep Guardiola to leave Manchester City.

items.title: Premier League news: Guardiola dismisses exit talk and Slot has ‚Äòmoved on‚Äô from Salah fallout
items.summary: Word from the top-tier press conferences, including updates on Viktor Gy√∂keres, Tyler Adams and Leeds reinforcements Continue reading...

items.title: Fifa owes fans thousands for resold World Cup tickets
items.summary: Customers who resold World Cup tickets on Fifa‚Äôs official platform say they are still waiting for thousands of pounds in payments.

items.title: Frank insists Tottenham players are 'still with me'
items.summary: Tottenham manager Thomas Frank says he "feels supported" despite their recent run of poor results and has no doubts the Spurs players are "with me or going in the same direction."

items.title: Alex Ferguson claims Manchester United could be 10 years from winning title
items.summary: ‚ÄòWe will not take that long,‚Äô says Amorim in response Amorim criticises sense of ‚Äòentitlement‚Äô at United Sir Alex Ferguson has stated it could take Manchester United another ‚Äú10 or 11 years‚Äù to win the title, prompting Ruben Amorim to publicly disagree with the club‚Äôs most successful manager. Ferguson won 13 of United‚Äôs 20 league titles, the last in 2013, and was asked when a 21st may be added to the trophy cabinet. Continue reading...
